perturbation.original_text: 4.01 Service Fees. In consideration of providing the Services set forth in Exhibit B, the Company agrees to pay to Contractor [ ** ] percent ([ *∗ ]%]) of Company's Gross Invoiced Sales (the "Service Fees"). Company agrees to have Fesnak & Associates, LLP pay the Service Fees directly to Contractor. Service Fees shall be paid to Contractor within five (5) days after the end of each month.
perturbation.changed_text: 4.01 Service Fees. In consideration of providing the Services set forth in Exhibit B, the Company agrees to pay to Contractor [ ** ] percent ([ *∗ ]%]) of Company's Gross Invoiced Sales (the "Service Fees"). Company agrees to have Fesnak & Associates, LLP pay the Service Fees directly to Contractor. Service Fees shall be paid to Contractor within thirty (30) days after the invoice date.
perturbation.explanation: The original text states Service Fees should be paid within five (5) days after the end of each month, but the modified text changes the payment deadline to thirty (30) days after the invoice date, introducing a conflict in payment terms. This creates uncertainty as to which deadline is enforceable.

perturbation.original_text: 4.03 Retention of Monies. During the Term of this agreement, and for a period of twenty four (24)months after Termination (the "Withholding Period"), Contractor may retain monies (collections in Accounts Receivable) against any reasonable anticipated deductions for product recalls, unsalables, rebates, allowances or any audits or other adjustments it deems necessary. The retention of monies shall only be to the extent that the reasonable anticipated deductions exceed the anticipated accounts receivables. At the end of the Withholding Period, Contractor shall remit to the Company the retained monies less any deductions charged by Customers against Company's Products. After the Withholding Period, Company will remain liable to Contractor for any additional audits, deductions, rebates, credits, allowances or other adjustments taken by the Customers against the Company's Products.
perturbation.changed_text: 4.03 Retention of Monies. During the Term of this agreement, and for a period of six (6) months after Termination (the "Withholding Period"), Contractor may retain monies (collections in Accounts Receivable) against any deductions for product recalls. The retention of monies will cover all the anticipated accounts receivables. At the end of the Withholding Period, Contractor shall remit to the Company the retained monies less any deductions charged by Customers against Company's Products. After the Withholding Period, Company will not liable to Contractor for any additional audits, deductions, rebates, credits, allowances or other adjustments taken by the Customers against the Company's Products.
perturbation.explanation: The original text allows for a 24-month withholding period for various deductions, while the modified text reduces this to 6 months and limits the deductions to product recalls only. Also it limits the company liability for audits, deductions, rebates, credits, allowances or other adjustments after the Withholding Period, creating a contradiction and uncertainty in enforcement.

perturbation.original_text: 8.02 Effect of Termination. Subject to Section 4.03, upon termination or expiration of this Agreement, other than with respect to any amounts then the subject of a good faith dispute, the Company shall pay to Contractor and Contractor shall pay to the Company all monies due in respect of the Services provided.
perturbation.changed_text: 8.02 Effect of Termination. Subject to Section 4.03, upon termination or expiration of this Agreement, all payments owed by the Company to the Contractor will be immediately forfeited. All payments owed by the Contractor to the Company will be due within thirty (30) days of termination or expiration.
perturbation.explanation: The original text states that both parties shall pay all monies due upon termination, whereas the modified text introduces an in-text contradiction by stating the Company will forfeit payments owed to the Contractor upon termination, while the Contractor is given 30 days to pay back the company. This creates uncertainty in enforcement.
